body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky
Kenton County } SS.
Personally appeared, before me Notary Public in and for the County aforesaid Thomas Nolan, and made oath as follows=

I am 45 years of age -- was born in the county of Roscommon Ireland -- was early in life and for 4 years a Fellow of Trinity College Dublin -- I emigrated to America many years since -- married -- was engaged for some time as Teacher in the Academy of Prattsville N. Y. -- subsequently taught nearly 2 years in the College of Burllington Vt. where by reason of over use of my eyes in reading and study -- as my physician told me -- I became nearly blind -- My eyesight has since been but feeble -- Have resided in Covington Ky. about 10 years.
My son Patrick James Nolan was born July 21, 1845 -- and is now in his 20th year.

In this city, and some months before he was convicted, with Bud Timberlake, of crime committed in Jefferson Co.
an intimacy had sprung up between my son and a sister of said Timberlake. I cannot say how long that intimacy existed -- for one year or thereabouts it was, to the best of my knowledge and information. On one occasion I know that my son was indisposed -- indeed sick -- I left him at home; and when I returned in the evening I found him gone; and my wife informed me that Miss Timberlake had called at the house for him, and they had gone away together. This was but a few weeks before the crime was committed at Louisville -- I did not see my son again; nor was he again at home since the day Miss Timberlake called for him. He was very extravagant in purchases, and went beyond his means and my own during his intimacy with that young woman. Almost all his money was spent for her.

Thos Nolan
R. RICHARDSON,
ATT'Y AT LAW
& COMMISSIONER
COVINGTON, KY.
6.23.'65
Subscribed and sworn to before me Thos. Nolan this June 23d 1865.

R. Richardson
N. P. K. C. Ky.
